intro: Pelargonium hybridifolium, commonly known as the hybrid geranium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves and clusters of showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and foliage. Pelargonium hybridifolium is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
